Another interpretation could be that the newspaper would deliberately put both of them side by side and above the fold.

Those hot button articles will appeal to *both* sides of the debate and the paper will sell more copies that day.

The reader will read what the reader wants to read.

high_score_comments.author: samacora
high_score_comments.body: Jesus as a new parent that hits straight to the core

high_score_comments.author: Azozel
high_score_comments.body: Becoming a parent can really change your perspective. Congrats on the new child.

high_score_comments.author: samacora
high_score_comments.body:
It completely changes your perspective , well it did for me anyway 

Before I settled down my mentality was completely different, things that were never even a thought for me was now a concern. My perception of what life is , what's fair what's just etc all flipped 


Before hearing stories like this or the kids being taken from parents at the border or anything like that wouldn't really touch me, now it just gets personified through my daughter and hits home.

high_score_comments.author: samacora
high_score_comments.body:
Yea that's so true. Parenthood has elevated my mom's pedestal so much , you don't appreciate the grind they go through for you day in day out and the stresses when your young. Or just seeing what my wife went through in pregnancy and labor 

Women are just fucking beasts seriously. As a man I thought I was tough and strong pfff got nothing on my wife

high_score_comments.author: nightmarefairy
high_score_comments.body: We need one one the mall in DC.  And one in front of NRA hq, wherever that is. Tragic terrible loss

high_score_comments.author: GreatBlueNarwhal
high_score_comments.body:
So, in the US, we tend to look at shooting with what I call the “Columbine Calendar.” For some reason, that’s when we consider it to have all began (it’s not, it’s just the first publicized occurrence).

That was in 1999, halfway through the Assault Weapons Ban, which had the effect of limiting access to firearms like the AR-15. So, it is worth noting that the era of school shooting *begins* during the strictest period of firearms law in the United States.

In 2004, the Assault Weapons Ban lapsed to much wailing and gnashing of teeth or applause and celebration depending on political leaning.

Nothing happens.

No, seriously. *Nothing happens.* The FBI collects and tracks crime data in the Uniform Crime Report. Over the years, you will see a trend beginning in the late 1980’s of violence beginning to decrease that continues through until today. The AWB came and went, and there is nary a bump in the trend line to signal its existence. Violence, of any type, neither improved nor worsened relative to a slow decay experienced by almost the entire developed world.

California, New Jersey, New York, Maryland, and several other states and individual cities enact legislation to control the type and use of firearms within their jurisdictions in response to the lapse of the Assault Weapons Bans or the ebb and flow of political tides.

Nothing happens.

In several states, Constitutional Carry passes, enabling citizens without criminal records to bear arms in public without individual licensure.

Nothing happens.

Concealed Carry Reciprocity passes, forming a network of states that each recognize each other’s license, allowing those with out-of-state licenses to bear arms in public.

Nothing happens.

Bump stocks and binary triggers appear, each purporting to increase the rate of fire of semiautomatic firearms.

Nothing happens.

An executive order is released to ban bump stocks under the assumption that they increase lethality.

Nothing happens.

The problems we have today absolutely were problems 20 or 30 years ago, and we haven’t been ignoring them, either. We’ve simply been chasing ineffective solutions.

Edit: I should also mention that several major universities now allow their students to bear arms on campus, a change that was met with the sound of thundering crickets.
